definition: low/beneath/to lower (one's head)/to let droop/to hang down/to incline
to harmonize/to reconcile/to blend/to suit well/to adjust/to regulate/to season (food)/to provoke/to incite
to transfer/to move (troops or cadres)/to investigate/to enquire into/accent/view/argument/key (in music)/mode (music)/tune/tone/melody

sentences.english: State-owned newspapers have been ordered to downplay the story.
sentences.chinese: 国有的新闻报纸被下令对钱案进行低调处理。

sentences.english: The wedding of Prince Edouard and his bride was a far more low-key affair however with only a few hundred people turning out onto the streets to watch them.
sentences.chinese: 爱德华王子的婚礼低调得多，仅有几百人沿街观看。

sentences.english: Chen Yibing, the "lord of rings", has always kept a low profile and is modest.
sentences.chinese: “吊环王”陈一冰总是保持低调，并且很谦虚。

sentences.english: My life is very simple low-key man Frank Gao Biao in real good.
sentences.chinese: 我的生存法很简单高标处世低调做人坦诚真实多好啊。

sentences.english: Yan in a low-key source said.
And the "low-key" launch via casual blog post?
sentences.chinese: 并且，用临时的博客帖子“低调的”发布？

sentences.english: For firms in search of capital and a low-key partner, CIC isappealing.
sentences.chinese: 对于寻找资金和低调合伙人的公司，中投很有吸引力。

sentences.english: Wulff told reporters that he had asked to keep security measures as low-key as possible.
sentences.chinese: 伍尔夫告诉记者，他之前就要求维安措施力求低调。

sentences.english: Boss: Keep a low profile, you ll have larger space to develop yourself.
sentences.chinese: 做人要低调，这样你才有更大的空间去发展。

sentences.english: Abramov's low profile also reflects his quiet, academic personality.
sentences.chinese: 阿布拉莫夫的低调也折射出了他安静的特点。

sentences.english: Durant has had the quietest, most understated summer of all.
sentences.chinese: 杜兰特的这个夏天则过得极为安静也极为低调。

sentences.english: Than Shwe well knows how a low-profile subordinate can overthrow the leader.
sentences.chinese: 丹瑞深知一个低调的属下能够对其上级进行颠覆。

sentences.english: In fact Jiang Chang Yi from start into to all finally be regarded as a more low-key person.
sentences.chinese: 其实蒋长义从始至终都算是一个比较低调的人。

sentences.english: Bennett was that low-profile during the season.
sentences.chinese: 我认为贝内特先生整个赛季都很低调。

sentences.english: Is only the groom's family individuality low key, therefore mentions inconveniently .
sentences.chinese: 只是男方个性低调所以不便讲出。

definition: expert/scholar/mother earth/a type of green tea
always (previously)/a period of time in the recent past
to steal the show/to grab the limelight
in touch with the common people/down-to-earth
amiable and approachable (idiom); easy-going/modest and unassuming/(of writing) plain and simple/easy to understand
